Legal_Issue: Admissibility of new evidence, standard of review for credibility findings
Procedural_Context: Appeal from Refugee Protection Division (RPD) decision
Credibility_Assessment: Central issue in original claim and RAD assessment
Basis_of_Claim: Refugee protection based on fear of persecution
Application_Error: Incorrect criteria for admitting new evidence, misapplication of reasonableness standard
Review_Outcome: Remitted to RAD for re-determination by a differently constituted panel
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard vs. correctness/judicial review standard
Application_Factor: Timeliness, relevance, and materiality of new evidence
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Refugee Appeal Division
Decision_Review_Issue: Failure to apply correct standard of review and error in evidentiary admission
Cause_of_Refusal: Alleged lack of credibility and refusal to admit new evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: New evidence not admitted due to incorrect criteria
Procedural_Fairness: Concerns about proper application of procedures in RAD decision
Credibility_Issues: Claimant's credibility questioned, RAD misapplied standard
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to RAD's legal interpretation and procedural fairness
Procedural_Issue: Improper standard applied in reviewing credibility and new evidence
Omission_Type: Failure to consider relevant evidence under proper legal framework
